title: The 2018â€“2020 Multi-Year Drought Sets a New Benchmark in Europe
why_it_matters: Provides quantitative evidence for the 2018-2019 Mediterranean drought anomaly with ~20% precipitation deficit and +2.8K temperature anomaly. Directly supports the temporal robustness claims about performance degradation in drought-affected regions.
target_sections: Results: Temporal robustness and legacy alignment
notes: Published in Earth's Future (AGU). Confirms manuscript claims about 2018-2019 Mediterranean drought. Consider fetching full text if access available.

title: Forest fire in Corsica, France (2017-08-14)
why_it_matters: Official EFFIS/Copernicus Emergency Management Service data documenting >1,800 hectares burned in Cap Corse (Ogliastro) in August 2017. Provides quantitative support for temporal performance degradation claims.
target_sections: Results: Temporal robustness and legacy alignment
notes: EMSR221 activation dataset. Already cited in manuscript via EU2024FireInfo but this provides specific event detail. Manuscript cites >1,700 ha; official source confirms >1,800 ha.

title: Recognition and Characterization of Forest Plant Communities through Remote-Sensing NDVI Time Series
why_it_matters: Demonstrates successful discrimination of three Quercus ilex-dominated forest associations using NDVI time series. Relevant background for understanding evergreen oak phenological signals and classification challenges in Mediterranean regions.
notes: MDPI Diversity journal. Open access. Shows NDVI can discriminate Q. ilex forest types but requires time series analysis.

title: Evergreen broadleaf greenness and its relationship with leaf flushing, aging, and water fluxes
why_it_matters: Documents low temporal variability in evergreen broadleaf canopy greenness and desynchronization between NDVI and vegetation functioning. Explains why Mediterranean evergreen forests show minimal embedding uplift.
notes: Agricultural and Forest Meteorology. Explains fundamental phenological challenges for evergreen broadleaf classification, supporting Mediterranean boundary condition discussion.

title: Use of Sentinel-2 for forest classification in Mediterranean environments
why_it_matters: Direct evidence of Sentinel-2 classification challenges in Mediterranean environments. Provides context for manuscript discussion of DLT limitations and Mediterranean performance convergence.
notes: IGARSS 2016 conference paper. Available on ResearchGate. Directly relevant to Mediterranean forest classification challenges with Sentinel-2.

title: Integrated use of Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 data and open-source machine learning algorithms for land cover mapping in a Mediterranean region
why_it_matters: Demonstrates importance of NIR and SWIR bands for Mediterranean vegetation classification, including sclerophyllous forests. Supports discussion of spectral challenges for evergreen broadleaf species.
notes: European Journal of Remote Sensing. Open access. Confirms SWIR/NIR importance for Mediterranean oak classification.

title: Mapping evergreen forests using a new phenology index, time series Sentinel-1/2 and Google Earth Engine
why_it_matters: Already cited in manuscript (line 62). Proposes phenology index specifically for evergreen forest mapping. Relevant baseline comparison for embedding approach to evergreen classification.
notes: Ecological Indicators. Already in references.bib. Confirms manuscript positioning against phenology-based methods.

title: European forest types: Categories and types for sustainable forest management reporting and policy
why_it_matters: Official Forest Europe reference defining Mediterranean sclerophyllous broadleaf forests (dominated by Q. ilex, Q. suber). Provides authoritative taxonomic context for deciduous/evergreen broadleaf distinction.
notes: EEA Technical Report. Defines Mediterranean evergreen oak types relevant to DLT limitation discussion.
